title: Rapper kicks fan off stage after he won't say 'f--k' Trump
text:
A video being widely shared on social media over the weekend shows rapper YG inviting a fan to join him on stage to say “f--k Trump," only to kick him off stage when the fan refuses.

“Listen, I spotted you out in the crowd. I asked you if you fucked with Donald Trump Donald John Trump Comey: Mueller 'didn't succeed in his mission because there was inadequate transparency' During deposition, official says he made several efforts to advocate for Marie Yovanovitch Bolton looms large as impeachment inquiry accelerates MORE, you said, ‘You don't know,’” the Los Angeles rapper said as the fan joins him on stage during YG’s performance Saturday at the Mala Luna Music Festival in Texas. “So, since you don't know, I need you to make up your mind tonight.”

ADVERTISEMENT

YG then asked the fan to say his name and yell out, “F--k Donald Trump.” The fan paused and then can be seen shaking his head no, prompting YG to kick him off the stage.

“Get his ass outta here,” YG said as he pushed the fan away while the crowd cheered. “Get him off the stage…He a Donald Trump supporter. Get his ass up outta here.”

The crowd proceeded to boo the fan as he left the stage.

YG invites fan on stage to yell out "F**k Donald Trump," kicks him off after he refuses pic.twitter.com/7z9r9gVXav — XXL Magazine (@XXL) October 27, 2019

The viral incident comes from the rapper famous for his track recorded with rapper Nipsey Hussle titled “FDT,” which stands for “f--k Donald Trump.”

In 2016 prior to Trump’s election, police were called to disperse a crowd the two rappers had gathered to help them shoot a music video for the song.
description: A video being widely shared on social media over the weekend shows rapper YG inviting a fan to join him on stage to say “f--k Trump," only to kick him off stage when the fan refuses.
